title: 'Was anxious about her future after my death': Former Isro employee murders wife in Bengaluru flat
content: A former ISRO employee, Nagesh Ishwar Rao, was arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly strangling his wife, Sandhya Shri, to death. Police revealed Rao cited anxieties about his wife's future as his motive. The couple's daughter, residing in the US, has been notified. An investigation into the tragic incident is ongoing.

title: Chinese robodog row at AI Impact Summit: Why is Galgotias University under fire? Explained
content: Galgotias University was asked to leave the AI Summit Expo after showcasing a Chinese-made robotic dog as an in-house innovation. The university clarified it did not build the robot but used it to inspire students, sparking a debate on domestic AI development versus global technology adoption.

title: Live stream to wall climbs: Bihar Class X board exams open in chaos
content: Bihar School Examination Board exams commenced with significant disruptions. A Facebook Live video from a Siwan exam centre raised security concerns. Students across districts attempted to scale walls to enter centres after arriving late. Incidents of cheating were also reported. Authorities are investigating the breaches and ensuring exam integrity.

title: Google AI CEO tells everyone why Gemini & ChatGPT winning International Maths Olympiad is not big
content: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated that AI systems solving complex Maths Olympiad problems do not prove general intelligence. These systems can still err on basic math and are 'frozen' after training. They struggle with long-term strategies and consistency across tasks. Hassabis emphasized the need for AI that learns continuously and plans for the future.

title: Pacers exploit conditions as South Africa storm into T20 World Cup Super 8s unbeaten
content: South Africa secured a commanding six-wicket victory over the UAE, boosting their morale heading into the T20 World Cup Super Eight stage. Despite a rain-interrupted start, the Proteas chased down 123 aggressively, with Dewald Brevis and Aiden Markram leading the charge.  Key performances from bowlers Corbin Bosch and Anrich Nortje were crucial in restricting the UAE.

title: Perplexity just 'sided' with Anthropic in its battle with ChatGPT-maker OpenAI, tells everyone...
content: AI search startup Perplexity has declared it will not feature ads in its chatbot answers, prioritizing subscription and enterprise sales over advertising. This strategy aligns with Anthropic and contrasts with OpenAI's ad-based monetization. Perplexity is aggressively expanding its business sales team to target large organizations and high-powered users, focusing on revenue and retention over user reach.

title: Cracks in INDIA bloc? Sena (UBT) backs Mamata or Stalin to lead oppn; cites ‘inner voices’
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) urges the INDIA bloc to strategize collectively before state elections, highlighting internal confusion within Congress.  The party's mouthpiece points to conflicting suggestions for leadership, including Mamata Banerjee and Stalin, questioning the alliance's post-election direction and stressing the need for unified action.

title: What is Unitree’s Go 2? Chinese robot at centre of Galgotias University row at AI Impact Summit
content: Galgotias University is facing criticism after a video showed a Chinese-made robotic dog, Unitree's Go 2, being presented as a university innovation at the India AI Impact Summit. While the university denies claiming development, a professor's introduction of the robot as 'Orion' has gone viral. The commercially available robot, costing around Rs 3 lakhs, boasts advanced navigation and interaction capabilities.

title: Kerala to Canada to T20 World Cup: Joji Varghese’s dream meeting with Sanju Samson
content: A former physical education teacher from Thiruvananthapuram, Joji Varghese, who moved to Canada for his children's future, fulfilled a lifelong dream by meeting his favourite cricketer, Sanju Samson. Now a massage therapist for the Canadian cricket team, Joji shared an emotional reunion with Samson during a practice session in India, highlighting Samson's humility and connection.

title: Rajpal Yadav walks out of jail; press conference planned after niece's wedding
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav has been granted temporary release from Tihar Jail in his cheque bounce case. He plans to address the media soon, stating that all legal matters are before the High Court. Yadav, who paid Rs 1.5 crore to suspend his sentence, is currently busy with his niece's wedding. His last film was 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3'.

title: 'Illegal' knives ordered from Blinkit used in murders? Delhi police book quick-commerce platform
content: Delhi Police have launched an FIR under the Arms Act after a quick-commerce platform, Blinkit, was found selling illegal knives.  Following two local murders, police discovered knives exceeding legal blade length and width being sold online.  Raids have since recovered 50 prohibited knives from various locations, with investigations ongoing.

title: ‘Kya karoge jaan ke’: Murdered MBA student’s boyfriend shows no remorse, smirks at reporters
content: Accused in the murder of an MBA student displayed striking indifference during a crime scene reconstruction, brushing aside reporters' questions. Police described his demeanor as unusually calm and detached, noting his claims of wanting to communicate with the victim's spirit and his consumption of occult content.

title: Cigarette stocks light up! ITC, Godfrey Phillips surge up to 12% on price hike reports
content: Cigarette stocks surged on Dalal Street as manufacturers raised prices to offset increased excise duties. ITC, Godfrey Phillips India, and VST Industries saw significant gains following reports of price hikes aimed at protecting margins. This move comes after the government's notification on a new tobacco taxation framework.

title: 'We had to wash dishes ...': Pakistan hockey captain lashes out at PHF
content: Pakistan's hockey captain, Shakeel Ammad Butt, has fiercely criticised the Pakistan Hockey Federation following a disastrous tour of Australia. Players endured severe accommodation issues, including being forced to wash dishes before matches, and faced significant delays and unconfirmed bookings. Butt stated the team's performance was negatively impacted by these embarrassing circumstances.

title: 'Chinese products showcased': Rahul Gandhi calls AI Impact summit 'disorganised PR spectacle'
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized the AI Impact Summit as a "disorganized PR spectacle," alleging Indian data is being sold while Chinese products are showcased. The Congress party echoed this sentiment, calling the event embarrassing and damaging to India's global image.

title: Impact of GST rate cuts fading? FMCG prices rise up to 5%; what's fueling the latest hike
content: Indian consumer goods companies are raising prices by up to 5% due to rising input costs and a weakening rupee. This follows a period of holding back on revisions after September's GST cuts, as companies now exercise pricing power. Increased costs for commodities like crude oil derivatives and imported ingredients are impacting profitability across various product categories.

title: 'Slit throat with scissors': Gurgaon CA murders pregnant banker wife after tiff during long drive
content: A chartered accountant was arrested for allegedly murdering his wife, a bank employee, just five months into their marriage. He claimed she was killed by robbers, but confessed to strangling and slitting her throat due to suspicions about her character. The crime scene was staged to resemble a robbery.

title: History made! Jammu and Kashmir stun Bengal to enter maiden Ranji Trophy final
content: Jammu and Kashmir achieved a historic Ranji Trophy final berth after 67 years, defeating former champions Bengal by six wickets.  Pace bowler Auqib Nabi's nine-wicket haul set up a manageable target, which Vanshaj Sharma and Abdul Samad expertly chased down. This remarkable victory marks a significant milestone for J&K cricket.

title: What is decoupling? The method US claims China used to conceal its 'secret nuclear test'
content: A senior US official claims new seismic data suggests China conducted an underground nuclear test in June 2020. Beijing vehemently denies this, calling the accusation baseless and a political ploy. The US official cited data from a Central Asian seismic station, while the CTBTO noted the events were too small to confirm.

title: Gold price prediction: When will gold rates resume upward bullish trend? Check outlook
content: Gold price prediction today: Maneesh Sharma, AVP - Commodities & Currencies, Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers is of the view that gold prices are likely to resume their upward trend in the long run. He takes a look at the top factors for gold prices in the coming days:

title: Civil suit against spouse’s lover for alienation of affection maintainable: Delhi high court
content: The suit was instituted by the wife (Plaintiff), seeking damages on the premise that she was entitled to the affection and companionship of her husband, who had withdrawn such affection on account of intentional conduct of another woman.

title: Loosening pyjama string is 'attempt to rape': SC sets aside Allahabad HC ruling
content: The Supreme Court has overturned a controversial Allahabad High Court ruling, declaring that groping a woman and untying her pyjama string constitutes an "attempt to rape." The apex court emphasized the need for judicial compassion and empathy in handling sexual offense cases, reviving stringent charges under the Pocso Act. A committee will now develop guidelines to foster sensitivity in judges.

title: Show of force? US sends 50+ fighter jets to Middle East amid talks with Iran
content: Amidst high-stakes nuclear talks with Iran, the US has significantly bolstered its military presence in the Middle East, deploying over 50 advanced fighter jets and extending troop deployments. This buildup, including air defense systems and cargo flights, coincides with indirect negotiations in Geneva aimed at a potential nuclear deal.  President Trump has previously threatened military action.

title: Next station is Meerut: Get ready for India’s fastest metro at 120 kmph
content: Meerut is set to launch India's fastest metro, boasting a maximum operational speed of 120 kmph. This 21-kilometer corridor will connect Meerut South to Modipuram with 12 stations, cutting travel time significantly. Notably, it will share tracks with semi-high-speed Namo Bharat trains, creating an integrated transport model.

title: Ouch, my joints! Why your 20s and 30s are no longer immune to joint pain
content: Joint pain is no longer exclusive to older adults; young people in their 20s and 30s are increasingly experiencing it. Sedentary lifestyles, poor posture, and ignoring early warning signs like stiffness or pain after exercise contribute to this trend. Experts urge prompt medical evaluation to prevent permanent damage and emphasize proper exercise and body awareness.

title: ‘Under vengeful instructions of Asim Munir’: Kin claims Imran Khan enduring mistreatment in prison
content: Imran Khan's family alleges "unimaginable mistreatment" and "deliberate cruelty" in prison, claiming his right eye's vision loss is due to inadequate health facilities. They demand his transfer to a private hospital for treatment, a demand echoed by his close aide and former cricketers. The government refutes these claims, presenting medical reports indicating improvement.

title: For reels, biker yanked doors of moving vehicles in Delhi, arrested after video goes viral
content: A 22-year-old man was arrested in Delhi for allegedly opening doors of moving vehicles while riding his bike, an act captured in a viral video. Police are searching for his accomplice. In a separate incident, another man was apprehended for performing bike stunts after India's cricket victory.

title: Abhishek Sharma eyes first runs as India face Netherlands before Super 8s
content: India face the Netherlands in their final World Cup league match, aiming for Abhishek Sharma to regain form ahead of the Super 8s. This fixture offers a valuable opportunity for acclimatisation to the Ahmedabad venue, where India will play their opening Super 8 fixture. Despite the one-sided look on paper, a large crowd is expected.

title: Salim Khan health update: Salman's father is on ventilator support
content: Renowned screenwriter Salim Khan has been hospitalized at Lilavati Hospital, currently requiring ventilator support. Medical professionals have diagnosed him with internal bleeding stemming from a spike in blood pressure and ruptured blood vessels. He has undergone surgery  today. Read the full article to know more in detail.

title: ‘We deserve what we’ve got’: Australia face backlash after ‘shambolic’ T20 World Cup exit
content: Australia's T20 World Cup journey ended abruptly, sparking outrage over their bowling frailties and questionable selections.  Former spinner Brad Hogg labelled the campaign "shambolic," highlighting a severe lack of bowling depth.  Injuries and strategic missteps, including the handling of Steve Smith, contributed to the stunning group-stage exit, leaving the team facing urgent structural reviews.

title: Rohit Shetty house firing: 7 lured with quick money for ‘mission’ by ‘Hindu Sainiks’, say cops
content: Investigations reveal the Shubham Lonkar gang used social media and local contacts to recruit shooters for the firing outside Rohit Shetty's home. Youths were promised money, fame, and identity. The main shooter received an advance payment. Police arrested seven more individuals, identifying two modules involved in the operation. Financial details are under verification as accused statements vary.

title: Dwarka car accident: Accused’s father says 'very sorry, regretful, was not in Delhi'
content: A grieving mother is demanding an underage driver be tried as an adult and stricter action against his father after her son's death. The father expressed regret but claimed he wasn't present during the accident. The case echoes a 2016 incident, reigniting debates on parental responsibility for minors driving high-end vehicles.

title: Bank holiday today: Are banks open on closed on February 18? Check state-wise details
content: Planning a bank visit? Be aware that Indian banks observe both national and state holidays, leading to varied closures. Today, February 18, Sikkim banks are closed for Losar. Maharashtra observes Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Jayanti on February 19, while Mizoram and Arunachal Pradesh celebrate State Day on February 20. Remember, second and fourth Saturdays also mean no branch operations.

title: Pakistan face must-win scenario, must beat Namibia to qualify for Super 8s
content: Pakistan fans express cautious optimism for a rematch with India, but the team must first secure a win against Namibia. Despite a loss to India, spinners Usman Tariq and Saim Ayub showed promise. Pakistan need to address bowling lapses and batting concerns, especially Shaheen Afridi's form, to advance in the tournament.

title: Hollywood icon Julia Roberts shares her spiritual experience
content: Academy Award-winning actor Julia Roberts' spiritual journey began with a photograph of Neem Karoli Baba, sparking a deep, personal connection to Hinduism. This quiet curiosity led her to India and the Kainchi Dham ashram, influencing her life and professional choices, like naming her production company Red Om Films.

title: 'No threat but vigilance is necessary': RSS chief renews 'united Hindus' pitch; backs 3-child policy
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat urged Hindu families to have at least three children, citing concerns over a declining population. He emphasized uniting and empowering the Hindu community, advocating for the detection and deportation of infiltrators. Bhagwat also stressed the importance of social harmony, addressing caste divisions, and uplifting the disadvantaged, asserting India's potential to guide the world.

title: CCTV Shows Teen Driving Scorpio Rashly Seconds Before Killing 23-Year-Old
content: In the latest CCTV footage, the SUV is seen narrowly missing a bus before ramming Sahil's bike. The alleged teen driver is also seen losing track of lane amid over speeding.

title: Opinion: Opinion | India's AI Impact Goes Beyond The US-China Binary
content: For years, global technology governance has been framed as a binary choice. The US' corporate-led model, and China's state-driven approach. India presents a unique alternative.

title: NVIDIA Once Tried To Buy Arm For $40 Billion. They've Now Sold All Shares
content: NVIDIA Corp. sold off the last of its stake in Arm Holdings Plc, a chip technology company that it tried and failed to acquire five years ago.

title: Puch AI's Siddharth Bhatia To Speak On Innovation, Ethics At NDTV AI Summit
content: Siddharth Bhatia, co-founder of Puch AI, is set to speak at theNDTV Ind.AI Summit at ITC Maurya in New Delhi.

title: Live Updates On Galgotias University AI Robot Controversy: Power Cut At Stall
content: A row has erupted at the India AI Impact Summit 2026, after Galgotias University showcased 'Orion', a Chinese-made robotic dog as a product developed by the its Centre of Excellence.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Set To Testify In Watershed Social Media Trial
content: Mark Zuckerberg will testify in an unprecedented social media trial that questions whether Meta's platforms deliberately addict and harm children.

title: "Sorry, Don't Accept Your Sorry": Biker's Mother On Teen's Father's Apology
content: Inna Makan, whose world came crashing down on February 3 when her 23-year-old son Sahil Dhaneshra died after his bike collided with a Mahindra Scorpio SUV driven by a teenager, is struggling to pick up the pieces

title: US, Iran Praise Progress In Nuclear Talks After Trump Threats
content: The US and Iran made progress in nuclear talks in Geneva on Tuesday, with Tehran's negotiators scheduled to return with a new proposal in two weeks, a US official said.

title: Bail Plea Of Doctor Arrested In Madhya Pradesh Cough Syrup Deaths Rejected
content: The decision came after a tense hearing on Tuesday, where the court observed that the gravity of the incident was too serious to grant any relief. With this order, all four accused will remain behind bars.

title: Meta Deepens Nvidia Ties With Pact For "Millions" Of AI Chips
content: Meta Platforms Inc. has agreed to deploy "millions" of Nvidia Corp. processors over the next few years, tightening an already close relationship between two of the biggest companies in the artificial intelligence industry.

title: AI Impact On Corporate Growth Seen As Limited Outside Big Tech
content: Anthropic PBC and Altruist Corp.'s new artificial intelligence models recently upended multiple industries leaving Wall Street in search of where exactly the productivity-boosting promise of AI will translate into higher corporate earnings.

title: Naina Avtr, India's First AI Influencer, Has 3.75 Lakh Instagram Followers
content: Naina Avtr is a digitally crafted persona created in 2022 by Avtr Meta Labs, India's first-ever content-driven meta-influencer company.

title: Voice To Become The Next Interface For AI: ElevenLabs CEO Mati Staniszewski
content: Voice will emerge as the dominant interface for artificial intelligence, ElevenLabs co-founder and CEO Mati Staniszewski has said.

title: Can AI Go Rogue? How Close Are We To Disaster? What OpenAI Told NDTV
content: AI is the biggest global technology disruptor after the internet. With more and more powerful and capable artificial intelligence being developed, are there any risks, something that often comes along with advances in technology?

title: Apple Ramps Up Work On Glasses, Pendant, Camera AirPods For AI Era
content: Apple Inc. is accelerating development of three new wearable devices as part of a shift toward artificial intelligence-powered hardware, a category also being pursued by OpenAI and Meta Platforms Inc.

title: "Jobs Will Be Lost, More Will Be Created": Nvidia's Jay Puri At NDTV AI Summit
content: Like every other technological disruption, some jobs will be lost and many more will be created due to artificial intelligence, Nvidia's Jay Puri said.

title: "Rahul Gandhi Most Dangerous Person For India's Security": Kiren Rijiju
content: Rahul Gandhi has become the most dangerous person for India's security, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju has said, accusing the Leader of the Opposition, Lok Sabha, of links with anti-India forces and meeting Maoists and extremists.

title: "Propaganda Campaign": Galgotias Claps Back After Chinese Robot Dogs Row
content: Galgotias University Chinese Robot Dog Controversy: Galgotias University has described the intense online and offline criticism over its display of a robotic dog at a major artificial intelligence event in New Delhi as a "propaganda campaign".

title: Who Is Kirthiga Reddy, Tech Executive And AI Leader At NDTV AI Summit
content: Kirthiga Reddy, CEO and co-founder of OptimizeGEO and Verix, is set to take the stage today at the NDTV Ind.AI Summit 2026.

title: "Does It Speak Gujarati?" What PM Modi Asked On Sarvam AI Product
content: Speaking at the NDTV Ind.AI Summit, Pratyush Kumar said that PM Modi stepped past a marked security line to examine Sarvam AI products at their stall at Bharat Mandapam.

title: MLBPA head Clark resigns after internal probe
content: MLBPA executive director Tony Clark resigned Tuesday after an internal investigation revealed an inappropriate relationship with his sister-in-law, who was hired by the union in 2023, sources told ESPN.

title: Texas Tech upset by ASU as Toppin exits with injury
content: Texas Tech star forward JT Toppin injured his lower right leg while driving to the basket with 6:03 remaining in Tuesday night's upset loss at Arizona State.

title: Vini Jr. accuses 'coward' Prestianni of racist abuse
content: Real Madrid forward Vinícius Júnior accused Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni of racially abusing him during the teams' Champions League playoff first leg on Tuesday.

title: UCLA's Cronin ejects own player after flagrant foul
content: UCLA coach Mick Cronin sent Bruins center Steven Jamerson II to the locker room after he fouled Carson Cooper from behind on a dunk attempt late in Tuesday night's blowout loss to Michigan State.

title: Agent: WR Evans plans to continue playing in '26
content: Wide receiver Mike Evans, the Buccaneers' all-time leading scorer, will play a 13th season in 2026 with the destination to be determined, his agent, Deryk Gilmore, told ESPN.

title: QB Rashada's suit vs. Napier, UF booster settled
content: A settlement was reached in the lawsuit filed by journeyman quarterback Jaden Rashada against former Florida football coach Billy Napier and a school booster over a failed NIL deal.

title: U-M reaffirms No. 1 ranking with win over Purdue
content: Michigan passed its first test this week by dispatching No. 7 Purdue to reaffirm the Wolverine's status at the No. 1 team in the country.

title: Union counters; WNBA calls proposal 'unrealistic'
content: The WNBA players' union submitted a counterproposal to the league Tuesday that included some concessions on revenue sharing and housing, sources told ESPN.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Shiffrin aims for gold, U.S. men's hockey begins knockout round and more
content: Wednesday at the Winter Olympics is headlined by Mikaela Shiffrin in the slalom and U.S. men's hockey beginning the knockout stage.

title: Women's Bracketology: Will Stanford miss the NCAA tournament again?
content: Teams with a high NET ranking are typically NCAA tournament locks. So why are the Huskers in the Last Four In?

title: The Bilas Index: Ranking the top 68 teams in men's college basketball
content: With a month until Selection Sunday, Bilas reveals which teams he has at the top of the pecking order.

title: Ideal fits for the NFL's 50 best free agents: New teams for Alec Pierce, Malik Willis, Riq Woolen
content: Which team makes the most sense for Pierce? Where do Willis and the QBs fit best? And where could defensive standouts excel?

title: Shiffrin aims for Olympic gold in slalom -- and this time, she's the favorite
content: Mikaela Shiffrin was not expected to medal in Sunday's giant slalom. On Wednesday, she's the front-runner to win gold in slalom.

title: Why the Lakers' quiet trade deadline could make for an explosive offseason
content: With LeBron James' uncertain future, draft assets and significant cap space this summer, the Lakers are set up to be a major offseason player -- and maybe even try to land Giannis Antetokounmpo.

title: USA vs. Canada is the women's hockey rematch everyone was waiting for
content: How did both teams get here? Who are the players to watch? We break down some of the storylines as the two powers in women's hockey are set to go head-to-head for gold.

title: The improbable comeback of Alysa Liu
content: After retiring from figure skating at 16, Alysa Liu returned on her own terms, with her own quirky style. And she's an Olympic gold medal favorite.

title: Champions League recap: Vinicius leads Madrid to win vs. Benfica, PSG with comeback
content: Enjoy all that happened from today's knockout phase playoff first legs, including Benfica vs. Real Madrid and AS Monaco vs. Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Fooled once but not twice, Real Madrid learned the right lessons for Benfica rematch
content: Three weeks after Benfica's shocking win over Madrid, Álvaro Arbeloa's team returned to Lisbon and proved lightning couldn't strike twice.

title: NBA Finals odds: Thunder, Nuggets still big favorites, Cavs volatile after Harden trade
content: The Cavs' title odds improved with the trade for James Harden, but the Thunder and Nuggets are clear favorites.

title: Paul, Shields, more react to Ronda Rousey vs. Gina Carano
content: Ronda Rousey and Gina Carano have returned to MMA, and the two will fight on Netflix in May. Here are the top reactions from social media.

title: Rousey vs. Carano is a sign of the times -- with a silver lining
content: Ronda Rousey vs. Gina Carano is an opportunity for two pioneers of women's MMA to have a night in the spotlight they created.

title: Reddick's Daytona 500 win a buzzer-beater befitting of his boss: Michael Jordan
content: The race itself was a near-perfect representation of what the Daytona 500 has become in recent years.

title: College baseball Week 1: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: With upsets of top teams and electric plays across the whole sport, how did the top 25 rankings shake out?

title: F1 testing LIVE: Charles Leclerc sets early pace from Lando Norris as crucial final week begins
content: Follow live updates and analysis of the second week of Formula 1's preseason test in Bahrain as the 2026 cars take to the track.

title: Ronaldo's next opponents have never lost a domestic match. Wait, what?
content: Which team has won every domestic match in its history? Which champions aren't based in the same country as their league? Here are football's unheralded powerhouses.

title: Meet Noahkai Banks, 19, the outside pick to make USMNT's World Cup squad
content: Noahkai Banks' strong form for Augsburg in the Bundesliga might not just get him in Mauricio Pochettino's USMNT squad for the World Cup -- he might even be a starter.

title: Transfer rumors, news: PSG, Liverpool join race for Villa star Rogers
content: Paris Saint-Germain and Liverpool have joined the race to sign Aston Villa attacking midfielder Morgan Rogers. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Lapsed fan guide: Dodgers rule, offseason moves, trades, more
content: Everything you need to know about the 2026 season for the fan who has been away and is looking to dive back in.

title: Fantasy draft guide: Rankings, tips, strategy, stats and more
content: All the rankings, projections, cheat sheets, strategy and analysis you need for the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

title: Need to maintain balance between innovation, regulation: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Manash Pratim Gohain is a seasoned journalist with over two decades at The Times of India, where he has built a rich body of work spanning education policy, politics, and governance. Renowned for his incisive coverage of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, accreditation reforms, and skilling initiatives, he has also reported on student politics, urban policy, and social movements. His political reportage—both reflective and news-driven—adds depth to his writing, bridging policy with public impact. Through his 2,500 articles and related outlets, he has emerged as a trusted voice in national discourse, particularly in linking education reform to broader societal change. title: 95-year-old unable to travel, Patna court goes to his house
content: a judge delivered the verdict in a 15-year-old bank fraud case . he pleaded for amnesty after imposing a fine of Rs 2,000 on him . the judge held him guilty, and disposed of the case after imposeing a 2,000 fine .

title: Twins from Odisha bag identical score in JEE Main
content: the twins studied together, tested together, walked away with identical marks till the last digit . they sat the same JEE Main (Session-I) 2026 shift . under NTA rules, candidates must declare if they are twins while filling out forms .

title: All 20 uniform sets for the 2026 World Baseball Classic, from Japan to Team USA
content: The World Baseball Classic is back this spring -- and so are new uniforms. Twenty teams from across the globe will vie for the title this March, with the game's biggest stars set to represent their respective nations.  Shohei Ohtani  will trade the  Los Angeles Dodgers ' customary blue for the colors of Japan, while  Aaron Judge  will swap the  New York Yankees ' iconic pinstripes for Team USA's red, white and blue. Each nation will have a white home jersey as well as an away jersey of a solid base color. Here's a complete roundup of each squad's look for the tournament.

title: Why is the Champions League so easy for Premier League teams now?
content: the UEFA Champions League playoff round kicks off this week . the defending champs of both the Eredivisie and Serie A didn't make the playoffs . they were eliminated from the league phase, as were two clubs from LaLiga .

title: College football had an incredible season. Remember how we got here
content: the Indiana Hoosiers raise the program's first football national championship trophy . college football has never been as fantastic as it is right now . the sport's blue bloods can still dominate, but new brands can compete for the ultimate prize .

title: The top bets to make heading into the NBA's second half
content: Stephon Castle joins "NBA Today" to weigh in on the Spurs' season so far . Andre Snellings and Eric Moody reevaluate teams and offer their bets heading into the second half of the season .

title: Buster Olney ranks MLB's top 10 relievers -- and there's no doubt about who's No. 1
content: coach Buster Olney ranked the best relievers in his 2026 season preview . he will roll out a position per day over the next two weeks . the team had checked in with the Athletics on Mason Miller's availability in the mid-2024 season .

title: Wyshynski predicts the Olympic bracket: Picks for each game, medal winners
content: the united states and Canada are on opposite sides of the 2026 Olympic men's hockey tournament bracket . the winger's seven points through four games ties him with Jaromir Jagr . he has been awesome for Czechia .

title: 🏈 Which teams nailed the CFB transfer portal?
content: the 2025 season offered the ultimate proof that elite portal recruiting can put a program in national championship contention . the offseason transfer window has officially closed with more than 3,200 FBS scholarship players making moves in January . here's a look at the key portal pickups to know for each Way-too-Early Top 25 team .

title: The biggest surprises of the men's Olympic hockey tournament
content: the 2026 men's hockey tournament has been thoroughly entertaining from start to finish . there is no other tournament where the best players are available to represent their countries with so much on the line . not every nation participated in last year's 4 Nations face-off .

title: Skubal or Skenes? What about Yamamoto? Olney ranks top 10 starting pitchers
content: buster Olney ranked the top 10 players at every position as part of his annual positional ranking series . the objective of this exercise is to identify the best players for the 2026 season, not who might be best in five years or over their career.

title: College softball: Week 2 Top 25 and how to watch
content: the Lady Vols are one of just four undefeated teams remaining in the poll . the poll contains the same 25 teams as last week's . here's the complete ranking of the top 10 teams in the nation .

title: Men's Bubble Watch: UCLA drops down after lopsided loss to Michigan State
content: the 2026 men's NCAA tournament is rapidly approaching . teams have roughly four weeks until selection Sunday to strengthen their cases . we'll use a variety of metrics as guides to track how each team on the "bubble" of the bracket is trending .

title: 11 trades we want to see this offseason: Barnwell finds new homes for 15 players
content: it has been only a week since Super Bowl LX . it's already time for NFL teams to start thinking about offseason trades . 'the bill is a mock trade,' says one of the juiciest trade proposals .

title: Kerala generates 596 million litres per day of untreated urban sewage
content: Kerala has set up STP projects for treatment of 435.83 MLD. Remaining urban sewage of 596.17 MLD is currently treated through various onsite facilities, says report by Local Self-Government dept submitted before NGT

title: Extra two fuel tanks on Ajit Pawar’s plane, says Rohit Pawar; demands to set up monitoring committee
content: The NCP (SP) MLA further raised concerns over the whereabouts of VSR Venture’s owner, V.K. Singh, and his son, Rohit Singh, who is Miami following the crash

title: From automated farm tractors to exam paper grading, AI boosts efficiency for some in India
content: Artificial intelligence is spreading fast across India, and people already use it to work quicker and cheaper

title: How to explore Theyyam season in north Kerala
content: As the Theyyam season reaches its peak, curated experiences run by locals in Kannur and Kasaragod offer travellers a deeper engagement with Kerala’s ritual art, sacred landscapes and centuries-old folklore. Here is how you can participate

title: Kerala’s KEAM 2026 engineering exam to follow Tamil Nadu-model normalisation formula with 50:50 weightage
content: Reform being reintroduced after former model faced strong opposition last year as it was implemented after entrance examinations had been conducted

title: Supreme Court forms committee to guide judges about sensitivity, compassion in judicial work
content: The judgment was triggered over a 2025 order by Allahabad High Court Judge who used explicit language to narrate a sexual assault on a minor girl

title: ED attaches asset linked to Malayalam actor Jayasurya in money laundering case
content: The actor and his wife were questioned by ED last December in a case of alleged cheating of some persons through an ‘online bidding’ application called ‘Save Box’

title: Madhya Pradesh Finance Minister Jagdish Devda tables ₹4.38 lakh crore Budget for 2026-27
content: Jagdish Devda tabled the Budget amid interruptions from the Opposition, which raised concerns over the "mounting debt" burden on the people of the State

title: Indian Navy vigilant in safeguarding country's maritime interests: President Murmu
content: Presiding over the International Fleet Review off Visakhapatnam, abroad an Indian Naval warship in the Bay of Bengal, the President said the Indian Navy is deployed in the region to serve as a credible instrument of deterrence and defence against threats and challenges arising in the sea

title: AI to revolutionise science, medicine; societal challenges need global cooperation: DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis
content: Demis Hassabis said the world is at a "threshold moment", with Artificial General Intelligence potentially on the horizon within the next five to eight years

title: Detailed project report being prepared for six-laning of Salem-Chengapalli stretch of NH 544
content: While the 54-km Chengapalli-Coimbatore stretch has already been widened to six lanes, the remaining 102.5-km stretch up to Salem continues to operate as a four-lane road

title: Kerala extends bar timings till midnight
content: Government issues notice extending operating hours by two hours. With this, bars and beer parlours in Kerala can function from 10 a.m. till midnight

title: Gaurav Gogoi just face of Assam Congress, Rakibul Hussain its ‘sole base’: Bhupen Borah
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma announced that Mr. Borah would be joining the BJP on February 22, after meeting him at his residence

title: Indo-U.K. offshore wind task force launched, India crosses 272 GW non-fossil fuel power capacity
content: Energy Minister said offshore wind has a strategic role in the next phase and promising zones have been identified off the coasts of Gujarat and Tamil Nadu

title: Open Day at Indian Institute of Astrophysics in Bengaluru on February 21
content: The institute will showcase a large number of demonstrations and interactive experiments on astronomy and basic physics, along with films, photographs, and walk-through exhibits about research at IIA and space sciences

title: Madanapalle minor girl’s rape, murder case: Prime accused found dead under suspicious conditions
content: The body was recovered from the village tank and shifted to the Government District Hospital at Madanapalle for post-mortem

title: I-PAC raids case: Supreme Court to decide if ED is ‘weaponised’ or ‘terrorised’
content: The ED has filed a petition seeking a CBI probe into the alleged obstruction of its raids at the offices of I-PAC by Mamata Banerjee and senior police officers who accompanied her

title: U.S. reveals new details of alleged Chinese nuclear test
content: A spokesperson for the Chinese embassy in Washington said the allegation about China conducting a nuclear test was “entirely unfounded” and an attempt “to fabricate excuses for resuming” U.S. nuclear testing

title: Interim report of high-level panel on Union-State relations tabled in T.N. Assembly
content: Making the Constitution more federal will not weaken the Union of India, says report tabled by Chief Minister M.K. Stalin

title: Newborn’s death after C-section sparks protests at Nedumangad taluk hospital in Kerala
content: Family refuses to accept body of infant and alleges that medical negligence led to the death. RMO at Nedumangad taluk hospital asked to go on leave

title: Airlines may impose flying ban on disruptive passengers
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation gets tough to curb unruly or disruptive behaviour of passengers

title: India AI Summit 2026: Galgotias University kicked out for showing off imported robotic dog at expo
content: The private university said in a statement that it has not built robodog, or claimed to have built it, adding that  they have consistently brought in cutting-edge technologies from the U.S. to China into campus

title: Not UN’s role to regulate AI, says Secretary-General Antonio Guterres as world body plans annual global dialogue
content: The statement by the UN in India said that discussions will focus on “how AI can accelerate progress towards the Sustainable Development Goals while safeguarding human rights and addressing emerging risks”

title: Biennial polls to 37 Rajya Sabha seats on March 16
content: Seats are falling vacant from Maharashtra, Odisha, Telangana, Tamil Nadu, Chhattisgarh, West Bengal, Assam, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh and Bihar

title: IED found on Srinagar-Baramulla highway in J&K
content: Security forces noticed a briefcase placed by the roadside at Narbal on the highway at around 7 a.m., officials said

title: Hanumanala residents protest against closure of village schools by government of Karnataka
content: Villagers would not be able to send their children to the school at Uppina Betageri because of the lack of a proper bus service

title: Kalyana Karnataka Chitra Santhe in Kalaburagi struggles to attract visitors, but student drawing competition shines
content: Deccan Art Society President Dr. Shaheed Pasha said the event was the first such attempt and hoped to improve future editions with better planning and promotion

title: Conventional financing remains a hurdle for pharma innovation, say industry leaders
content: Speaking at CEO Conclave at BioAsia, pharma industry leaders said apart from financing, facilitative measures to accelerate the process include regulatory support

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly pays tribute to Ajit Pawar, S.S. Rajagopalan
content: Assembly Speaker M. Appavu read out the condolence message, and the House stood in silence as a mark of respect

title: Three new cubs born to Cheetah Gamini in M.P.'s Kuno Park; India's count rises to 38
content: Each birth strengthens the foundation of Project Cheetah and reflects the passion, perseverance, and round-the-clock dedication of the field staff and veterinary teams who have nurtured this dream into reality, Bhupender Yadav

title: RJD will expand beyond Bihar, aspire to become national party: Tejashwi Yadav
content: Mr. Yadav also urged party workers to remember that "we lost the assembly polls in Bihar not because we were weak, but because we had fallen on hard times. Our time is bound to come"

title: Woman set on fire in Telangana after rejecting marriage proposal
content: The accused, identified as 40-year-old Kunta Anjaiah, who runs a milk shop at YSR Junction, was in a relationship with the woman, V. Sandhya, alias Manjula

title: India tells global tech platforms to follow constitution after tougher content rules
content: India’s information minister said on Tuesday that big tech platforms ​like Google’s YouTube, Meta, X and ‌Netflix must operate within the country’s ​constitutional framework

title: On the importance of satire
content: Can satire, comedy or a work of art be a threat to national security or defence of the nation? The Supreme Court has consistently held that satire is one of the most effective art forms revealing the absurdities, hypocrisies and contradictions of life

title: Indian cricketers not shaking hands with Pakistani counterparts is ‘dadagiri’ by BJP, alleges Raut
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader said his party is of the opinion that matches should not be played between India and Pakistan

title: Roundtable on Kerala’s future development to be held in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The roundtable aims to create a blueprint for the State’s development in areas such as health, education, agriculture, industry, science and technology, gender justice, research, climate change, environment, food security, and knowledge-based economy

title: TTD presents ‘silk vastrams’ to Srikalahasti temple
content: The TTD delegation offered prayers to the presiding deities of Vayulingeswara and Goddess Gnana Prasunambika

title: ‘Safalam 2026’ to be held in city on February 19
content: A documentary on SAF’s activities will be released at the event. Entrepreneurs associated with SAF for the past 15 years will be honoured on the occasion

title: How ordinary people of Tamil Nadu participated in the making of the Constitution
content: A resident of Kattunedungulam village of the Sivaganga district, sent a hand-written note with a demand that members of his community should have freedom of worship and autonomy to manage their own community

title: Madras as seen in 1942
content: The city, as seen in the 1942 film En Manaivi, seems another world. From there to the Chennai of today, we have come a long way

title: Odisha looking to increase its contribution to national GDP from 3% to 5%: Governor
content: Endowed with nearly one third of India’s total iron ore reserves, Odisha contributed over 61% of the country’s total iron ore production in 2024–25 and holds the first position in the production of steel and stainless steel in the country, says Kambhampati

title: Village headman among 27 persons booked after seven persons get injured at Mayana Kollai festival in Vellore
content: The police said that as per norms, temple chariots should not exceed 12 feet in height. However, during the festival, the chariots were reportedly around 60 feet tall, resulting in the collapse

title: A Lok Sabha election defeat and dismissal of the MGR Government
content: Nearly a month later when there were talks in the corridors of power that the Indira Gandhi Government may dismiss governments in opposition-ruled States – citing the precedent set in 1977 by the Janata Party Government, MGR described it as “speculation”

title: Congress protest march stopped in Lucknow amid face-off with police; party says ‘all limits of brutality crossed’
content: The Congress party vowed to intensify resistance against “anti-people policies” of the BJP governments in the State and Centre

title: Central experts visit Haryana’s Palwal following mysterious deaths and illness
content: Deputy Commissioner Harish Kumar Vashisht stated that during the investigation, it was found that all cases had a common condition of acute liver failure, characterised by a rapid decline in vital parameters and multi-organ failure

title: Opposition slams ruling alliance over welcome to Macron
content: Political parties and citizens on social media also sought action against the hoardings which they said were put up in contravention to the Bombay High Court order against them

title: Nitish’s son Nishant all out in public before getting any role in the party
content: For the first time, in the individual capacity, he has started inspecting the developmental work which has been launched or started by his father Nitish Kumar

title: BJP back to Rath Yatras to boost political prospects in West Bengal
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address a gathering at Kolkata’s Brigade Parade Grounds at the culmination of the yatras across the State

title: In allegation of electoral corruption, guilt has to be proved to the hilt, Sibal submits in Supreme Court
content: He was countering an appeal filed by S.S. Duraisamy alleging that there were videos and photos, contained in CDs, allegedly showing corrupt practices committed ahead of the 2011 election of M.K. Stalin, including the distribution of money to lure voters

title: Congress MLA loses seat in Karnataka for false claim of ‘nil’ tax dues when he actually owed over ₹1.3 crore
content: With this verdict, S.N. Subba Reddy ceases to be an MLA unless the Supreme Court stays this verdict, as the High Court had declined to keep its verdict in abeyance to enable the Congress leader to approach the apex court

title: All accused in father-son duo murder during Bemetara communal violence acquitted
content: Seventeen men were arrested for murdering an elderly man and his son, cattle grazers from Biranpur village in Chhattisgarh, in 2023

title: 31 govt. plots ‘illegally’ allocated at 5% of market value for Congress Bhavans in Karnataka: Chalavadi
content: Most of these lands were civic amenities (CA) sites that were not supposed to be allocated for the construction of political party offices, he alleged

title: Black box of aircraft from Ajit Pawar’s crash sustained damage
content: A Learjet 45 crashed in Baramati, Maharashtra, on January 28, killing Pawar, both the pilots, a cabin crew member and staff of the leader

title: IT Minister apologises for AI summit troubles; Kharge slams ‘mismanagement’
content: Attendees criticise arrangements on Day 1; flag theft of displayed products and lack of basic amenities; Minister says correction action taken

title: Carrier India all set to invest ₹1,000 crore in manufacturing unit in Sri City
content: Carrier India’s Managing Director Sundaresan Narayanan and Sri City’s Managing Director Ravindra Sannareddy formally exchanged copies of the lease deed in the presence of the Tirupati district Collector S. Venkateswar

title: Mission Mausam to make India weather- ready and climate-smart: official

title: India’s first private sector helicopter final assembly line inaugurated near Kolar in Karnataka
content: The facility in Vemagal in Kolar district of Karnataka, is India’s first private-sector helicopter Final Assembly Line for the Airbus H125

title: Budget will be planned to integrate climate action in schemes across departments: Stalin
content: At the summit, Mr. Stalin launched the TN-SHORE scheme, under which ₹1.7 crore has been earmarked as revolving funds and micro-credit support for 34 mangrove conservation committees

title: DMK regime has let down government employees, alleges Palaniswami
content: Speaking to presspersons after the Interim Budget speech at the Assembly, he contends that not even one-fourth of the DMK’s electoral promises, made in the run-up to the 2021 Assembly polls, had been fulfilled

title: Supreme Court lists appeals against suspension of Lalu Prasad’s sentence in fodder scam case in April
content: The case revolved around withdrawals of crores of rupees from the State treasury between 1992 and 1995

title: India, France renew defence cooperation for 10 years, call to boost military partnership
content: India has asked France to increase “indigenous content” in the Rafale by up to 50%, and also expand the Rafale’s maintenance, repair and overhaul facility in India

content: The announcement by Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma ends speculation about which way Borah will go
